items.title: HashKey’s lukewarm debut tests Hong Kong’s ambitions as digital asset hub
items.creator: Aileen Chuang

items.translated_title: HashKey’s lukewarm debut tests Hong Kong’s ambitions as digital asset hub

images.alt: HashKey, founded in 2018, offers crypto transaction facilitation, as well as on-chain, asset management and tokenisation services. Photo: Images/LightRocket via Getty Images
images.title: HashKey, founded in 2018, offers crypto transaction facilitation, as well as on-chain, asset management and tokenisation services. Photo: Images/LightRocket via Getty Images

items.content:
Shares of HashKey Holdings, operator of Hong Kong’s largest licensed cryptocurrency exchange, fluctuated on their trading debut, as investors shunned risk amid a downturn in both equity and digital asset markets.
Trading under the stock code 3887, HashKey shares first changed hands on Wednesday at HK$6.70, or 0.3 per cent above the offer price of HK$6.68 a share. The stock rose as much as 6.6 per cent before ending 2.7 per cent lower at HK$6.50 at the noon break.
The firm, one of 11 licensed...

items.title: MetaX soars 570% in debut as traders snap up second Chinese GPU maker to go public (原标题: MetaX soars 569% in debut as traders snap up second Chinese GPU maker to go public)

items.translated_title: MetaX soars 570% in debut as traders snap up second Chinese GPU maker to go public

images.alt: MetaX was founded in 2020 by former AMD employees. Photo: Handout
images.title: MetaX was founded in 2020 by former AMD employees. Photo: Handout

items.content:
MetaX Integrated Circuits soared on its trading debut in Shanghai, as investors piled into the second producer of graphics processing units (GPUs) to go public this month amid optimism about China’s push for self-sufficiency in semiconductors and artificial intelligence.
The shares of the Shanghai-based company began trading at 700 yuan on Wednesday on the technology-heavy Star Market, surging 569 per cent from their offer price of 104.66 yuan. The gain extended to 688 per cent to 824.50 yuan at...

items.translated_title: China’s new drug insurance: lifeline for patients or squeeze on big pharmaceutical firms?

images.alt: Leqembi, which costs a mainland Chinese patient about US$28,400 a year, may see its out-of-pocket price cut by half. Photo: Getty Images
images.title: Leqembi, which costs a mainland Chinese patient about US$28,400 a year, may see its out-of-pocket price cut by half. Photo: Getty Images

items.content:
Mainland China’s 17 million Alzheimer’s patients can, for the first time, pay less out of pocket for a costly drug touted as “historic” and “the beginning of the end” for the memory-robbing disease after Beijing launched a commercial insurance innovative drug list in an effort to make medicines more accessible and affordable.
Leqembi, developed by Japan’s Eisai and costing a mainland Chinese patient about US$28,400 a year, could see its price cut by half after it was added to the inaugural...

items.title: China’s Qwen and DeepSeek edge out US AI models in Christian values benchmark

items.translated_title: China’s Qwen and DeepSeek edge out US AI models in Christian values benchmark

images.alt: Alibaba Cloud’s Qwen3 achieved the highest score among 20 models evaluated by Colorado-based AI company Gloo as part of its Flourishing AI Christian benchmark. Photo: Shutterstock
images.title: Alibaba Cloud’s Qwen3 achieved the highest score among 20 models evaluated by Colorado-based AI company Gloo as part of its Flourishing AI Christian benchmark. Photo: Shutterstock

items.content:
Chinese artificial intelligence models from Alibaba Cloud and DeepSeek have edged out US-developed models to feature in the top six of a new ranking of leading AI models’ alignment with Christian worldviews.
Alibaba Cloud’s Qwen and DeepSeek’s R1 models were evaluated along with a host of leading US models as part of Colorado-based AI company Gloo’s Flourishing AI Christian (FAI-C) benchmark, which was launched on Monday.
Led by former Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger, Gloo said its benchmark tested AI...

images.alt: CreateAI’s Animon.ai platform allows users to upload an image or a text prompt and generate short anime-style video sequences without specialist training or professional software.

images.alt: Actors in mocap suits perform inside the 2,000-square metre space, supplying high-precision movement data for game, film and animation projects that require realistic character motion.
images.title: Actors in mocap suits perform inside the 2,000-square metre space, supplying high-precision movement data for game, film and animation projects that require realistic character motion.

items.content:
[The content of this article has been produced by our advertising partner.]
A team once known for building autonomous driving intelligence is now using the same technical discipline to unlock new creative possibilities. Their work has produced Animon.ai, which CreateAI presents as the World’s First AI Video Generator built specifically to generate anime-style videos from a single image or idea.
“We haven’t left AI. We have redirected world-class autonomous driving capabilities into AIGC,” says...

images.title: Ms. Beatrice Tai, Co-founder and COO of PCG introduces PCG’s stablecoin settlement pilot program during the Cyberport’s BCDA Group Interview

items.content:
[The content of this article has been produced by our advertising partner.]
As Hong Kong advances toward regulated digital money, a new era of digital payments is taking shape. With the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) preparing for licensed, fully asset-backed HKD stablecoins as early as 2026, the city is moving beyond the volatility of “crypto” and into a future of where money moves instantly, securely and at lower cost.
Stablecoins Are Not Crypto — They Are Digital Cash
For many people,...

items.translated_title: Rapid advances in China’s AI video space lead to widespread tech adoption
items.content:
China’s artificial intelligence video market is heating up as companies race to launch generative tools, promising to produce high-quality, realistic clips, fuelled by the growing adoption of AI in video creation across industries.
Beijing-based Shengshu Tech, the first mainland Chinese firm to roll out a challenger to OpenAI’s Sora video generation tool, on Tuesday unveiled an AI agent it said was a “one-click professional video creation tool”, capable of turning images into high-quality,...

images.alt: “Welcome AMD” displayed on multiple electronic screens at Lenovo headquarters in Beijing on Tuesday. Photo: Sina
images.title: “Welcome AMD” displayed on multiple electronic screens at Lenovo headquarters in Beijing on Tuesday. Photo: Sina

items.content:
Lisa Su, chair and chief executive of Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), began a visit to China on Tuesday, meeting Chinese computer giant Lenovo in Beijing just days after US President Donald Trump said Washington would ease restrictions on certain chip shipments to China.
Su and other AMD executives visited Lenovo’s headquarters, where photos circulating on Chinese social media showed multiple digital screens displaying “Welcome AMD”.
On RedNote, Lenovo’s official account replied to one post with a...

items.translated_title: Xpeng, Li Auto latest to get approval to test ‘hands-off’ driving amid slowing car market

images.alt: Electric vehicles on show at Xpeng’s headquarters in Guangzhou, in southern China’s Guangdong province, November 5, 2025. Photo: AFP
images.title: Electric vehicles on show at Xpeng’s headquarters in Guangzhou, in southern China’s Guangdong province, November 5, 2025. Photo: AFP

items.content:
Two leading Chinese electric vehicle (EV) makers, Xpeng and Li Auto, have been granted licences to test their level 3 (L3) autonomous driving technologies in designated urban areas, the latest sign that Beijing is encouraging wider use of advanced driver assistance systems amid a slowing automotive market.
The green light came just one day after the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology (MIIT) gave another two carmakers – Changan Automobile and BAIC – approvals to start assembling new...

items.translated_title: Biren Technology’s Hong Kong IPO gets green light as China’s AI chip firms rush to list
items.content:
Beijing has greenlit Biren Technology’s initial public offering (IPO) in Hong Kong, as more Chinese artificial intelligence chip designers rush to go public amid heightened investor interest in these stocks.
Biren, which designs high-performance graphics processing units (GPUs), received regulatory approval to list on the Hong Kong stock exchange, according to a China Securities Regulatory Commission filing on Monday. This was expected to put the company on track to become the first GPU...

images.alt: Shanghai’s Nasdaq-style Star Market this week sees the trading debut of another Chinese AI chip designer, MetaX, after Moore Threads Technology earlier this month. Photo: Reuters
images.title: Shanghai’s Nasdaq-style Star Market this week sees the trading debut of another Chinese AI chip designer, MetaX, after Moore Threads Technology earlier this month. Photo: Reuters

items.content:
Chinese artificial intelligence chip designer MetaX Integrated Circuits will make its trading debut in Shanghai on Wednesday, according to a filing late on Monday, more than a week after industry peer Moore Threads Technology’s stellar listing on the city’s Star Market.
Founded in Shanghai in September 2020 by former engineers at Advanced Micro Devices, MetaX priced its initial public offering at 104.66 yuan per share, which was expected to raise 4.2 billion yuan (US$596 million) from the sale...

images.title: Shanghai Scizeng Medical Technology is a unit of Changchun High-Tech Industry. Photo: Handout

items.content:
A Chinese biopharmaceutical firm has sealed a global licensing deal valued at up to US$1.44 billion, the second in a week, as a wave of cross-border tie-ups shows no sign of abating despite headwinds from the US Biosecure Act.
Shanghai Scizeng Medical Technology, a unit of Changchun High-Tech Industry, has agreed to grant US-based Yarrow Bioscience exclusive global rights to develop, manufacture and commercialise GenSci098, an injectable therapy for thyroid eye disease and Graves’ disease, both...

images.alt: The Ministry of Industry and Information Technology headquarters in Beijing. Photo: Handout
images.title: The Ministry of Industry and Information Technology headquarters in Beijing. Photo: Handout

items.content:
Beijing has approved China’s first two cars with level 3 (L3) autonomous driving capability, taking a leap towards widely deploying self-driving technology in the world’s largest automotive market.
The Ministry of Industry and Information Technology (MIIT) announced on Monday that Changan Automobile and BAIC were given the go-ahead to build electric vehicles (EVs) that would allow drivers to be hands off in some circumstances.
But the cars, both pure EVs, could only navigate urban streets and...

images.alt: It is estimated that by around 2035, the population aged 60 and above in mainland China will exceed 400 million. Photo: Xinhua
images.title: It is estimated that by around 2035, the population aged 60 and above in mainland China will exceed 400 million. Photo: Xinhua

items.content:
Chinese fintech giant Ant Group has pressed ahead with its strategic move into the fast-growing healthcare sector with a major upgrade to its artificial intelligence health app AQ, positioning the platform to work like a fitness companion or a family doctor.
The new features included integration of records from smart devices made by Apple, Huawei and Omron, among others, as well as the creation of health profiles for family members, the company announced on Monday. Ant is the fintech affiliate...

items.title: ByteDance dominates China’s tech hiring as AI talent demand surges

items.translated_title: ByteDance dominates China’s tech hiring as AI talent demand surges
items.content:
TikTok owner ByteDance is the top recruiter in China’s tech sector this year, while at the same time artificial intelligence-related job postings on the mainland have risen more than 500 per cent, according to a report by Maimai, China’s largest professional social networking platform.
ByteDance dominated tech hiring between January and October, with a hiring index of 897, ahead of Meituan at 587 and Alibaba Group Holding at 407, while AI related job listings surged 543 per cent, the report...

items.translated_title: Huawei’s Kirin 9030 processor shows China’s chip progress despite US export curbs: report

images.alt: Huawei’s flagship Mate 80 series smartphones. Photo: Handout
images.title: Huawei’s flagship Mate 80 series smartphones. Photo: Handout

items.content:
Huawei Technologies’ latest Mate 80 series smartphones are powered by an upgraded in-house chip after its foundry partner made improvements to the 7-nanometre node process despite US export restrictions on advanced technology, according to a new report.
The Kirin 9030, the processor behind Huawei’s Mate 80 Pro Max, was manufactured by China’s top foundry Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp (SMIC) using the N+3 process, which is a “scaled evolution” of the chipmaker’s previous 7-nm...

items.translated_title: Chinese expert calls for world models and safety standards for embodied AI

images.alt: A robot dog is tested at the International Embodied Intelligence Skills Competition. Photo: Handout
images.title: A robot dog is tested at the International Embodied Intelligence Skills Competition. Photo: Handout

items.content:
Andrew Yao Chi-chih, a world-renowned Chinese computer scientist, said embodied artificial intelligence still lacks key foundations, stressing the need for interpretable “world models” and more diverse data-collection methods.
Speaking on Saturday at an industry event in Shanghai, Yao said core capabilities such as “reasoning, planning and control should ultimately be integrated within a unified framework”, noting the importance of world models instead of simulating. He added that “scalable new...

items.title: Why Nvidia’s H200 is unlikely to derail chip ambitions of China’s Huawei, Moore Threads

items.translated_title: Why Nvidia’s H200 is unlikely to derail chip ambitions of China’s Huawei, Moore Threads

images.alt: The H200 is the latest generation of Nvidia’s Hopper-series chips. Photo: Handout
images.title: The H200 is the latest generation of Nvidia’s Hopper-series chips. Photo: Handout

items.content:
The US approval for Nvidia’s H200 artificial intelligence processors will give China a much-needed boost in computing power rather than pose a direct threat to domestic chips, even though the US chip is more powerful than rivals from Huawei Technologies and Moore Threads, according to analysts.
With a total processing performance (TPP) of 15,832, the H200 has surpassed all AI chips made by domestic vendors on the market so far as well as Nvidia’s H20, which was previously the most advanced...

items.title: Kimi developer Moonshot shows China’s growing AI depth: US government report
items.creator: Vincent Chow
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Kimi developer Moonshot shows China’s growing AI depth: US government report

images.alt: Zhipu AI is another Chinese AI company identified in an end-of-year review as among major contributors to the global open-source AI landscape. Photo: Shutterstock
images.title: Zhipu AI is another Chinese AI company identified in an end-of-year review as among major contributors to the global open-source AI landscape. Photo: Shutterstock

items.content:
Leading Chinese artificial intelligence start-up Moonshot AI has been singled out as evidence of the “growing depth” of China’s AI industry, according to a new US government report.
An increasing number of Chinese companies were now developing world-leading “open-weight” AI models, not just DeepSeek, the Center for AI Standards and Innovation (CAISI) at the Department of Commerce said on Friday.
The CAISI report was the second US government evaluation of a leading Chinese model developer, after...
